You've learned to untangle and reshape the fabric of reality in harmony with your words and music. Your spells are part of your artistic repertoire, magic that you can tune to different situations. You use&reference[ charisma] as your@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.sxKTtNPUrcDvMDFj.JournalEntryPage.arD4KLvgCPbi1Pl7]{spellcasting ability}for bard spells, since your magic draws on powerful emotion as you speak or perform music.

Bards are &reference[knownspells]{known spellcasters}. The @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.SmG14gsqWBtqmcjt]{Bard Progression Table} shows how many spell slots you have, as well as how many cantrips and spells you know. You can search the @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.vaLYevRxKe8mAvdE.JournalEntryPage.bOMm72Xmest4hBy4]{list of bard spells here}.

Spellcasting Focus or Instruments

You can use an arcane focus, component pouch, or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#musical-instrument]{musical instrument} as a@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.sxKTtNPUrcDvMDFj.JournalEntryPage.R25K8TvAPK3c4ywr]{spellcasting focus}for casting bard spells. If you use a musical instrument as your spellcasting focus or you choose to sing, the music you make replaces your spells' normal somatic or verbal components (though some spells require you to speak or perform specific gestures).
